inn1.comm: short of a length, on off, defended off the front foot
short of a length again, just outside off, leaves him late, squares him up, and beats his defence
steps down the wicket a little, Ravi shortens the length a little, played to leg for no damage
short of a length, outside off, steered down to third man
fuller, wider, left alone
pulls the length back again, gets on top of off, and Guptill leaves it on the bounce
short of a length, just outside off, defended off the front foot
length ball, shaping away, Nicol is forward to defend
That's Six No. 1. We are expecting many more today. Nicol shimmies down the track, takes this on the half-volley, from well outside off, and flicks it towards wide long-on. Not good signs for bowlers
short of a length, well outside off, left alone
nipping in a little off a length, defended off the front foot
length ball, on off, 125ks, no movement, defended towards mid-off
on a length, 135ks, on off, holding its line, defended to cover
slightly shorter but Guptill is forward again in defence
this time Guptill shimmies down, and while he doesn't get all of it, he gets four nonetheless. Aiming to go over mid-off, gets a thick edge that clears point with ease
length ball, into the pads, and Guptill misses out on that offering. Hit on the pad as he flicks a little too early
short of a length, just outside off, punched away, but not too far off extra cover
effort ball, bouncer at 140ks, Guptill slightly late into the pull, but gets a couple as the bottom edge goes past square leg
misses out here. This was so wide it would have been called a wide, but Nicol went for the cut, and couldn't beat cover-point
another mis-hit that clears the infield. Nicol leaves the crease again to try to go over mid-off, but the movement away from him means the ball goes right off the cue. It clears mid-off, though
these are not good signs for bowlers at all. This is short of a length, and he has swat-pulled this over mid-on. Oh batsmen are finding this pitch too trustworthy
length ball, on off, defended off the front foot
another forward-defensive
slower ball now, short of a length, no room, patted back to him
short of a length, no room, pushed to mid-on
short of a length again, into the pads, punched down to mid-on

this is a little ridiculous. Short ball, outside off, and he has punched it down the ground for four. No fear of the bounce. A little misjudgement from Charles at mid-off who runs the other way to begin with, and is beaten on the left. No dive offered either
left alone just outside off. More on the bounce
angling in towards middle and leg, punched to midwicket
gets a little big on him, but he still manages to punch it to mid-on, and steal a single

Given lbw. Guptill has a chat with Nicol, and decides against reviewing it. This one skids a little, and does him in for the pace a little. Short of a length, just outside off, and he is deep into the crease to try to punch it. The ball nips back in, and skids off and hits him on the knee roll in front of middle and leg. Hitting top of leg
and begins with a defensive shot towards mid-off
short of a length, gives him a bit of room, and he goes after it. Smith, though, dives to his right at point, and concedes no run
looks to run this behind square, and this time Sammy at gull dives to his right to deny Flynn
nearly a run-out. Flicked to fine leg, Flynn always wants a second, but as he turns back he sees Rampaul has already swooped on it, and he sends Nicol back, who dives full length to save his wicket
short of a length, just outside off, defended back to him
lenght ball, middle and leg, pushed to leg
length ball, gives him a bit of space to drive, and he places it between mid-off and extra cover
short of a length, on the pads, beaten for pace, hit on the pad
heavy ball, short of a length, hits the sticker of the bat outside off
fuller, outside off, defended towards cover
nicely worked away off the pads, wide of deep midwicket for a couple
back of a length, not much room, defended off the back foot
steps down the wicket, pushes this to mid-on who is right at the edge of the circle
looking to pull but is too early into the shot, and cues it towards mid-off
plum half-volley on off, and he has driven it down the ground and along the ground, between mid-off and Russell. Picked the slower ball early, and waited for it to arrive
short of a length, on leg, pushed off the front foot towards mid-off

that's No. 2. This ground promises some carnage. Short of a length, and he sets himself up, goes across the line, and pull-swipes it over midwicket for an easy six. Just before this delivery, Ian Bishop said he wouldn't want to bowl on this ground. who can argue?
wide down the leg side
walks down the wicket only to find out he has dug it in, and fends it back to him
short of a length, punched away towards deep midwicket
short of a length, middle and leg, heading towards off, defended off the back foot
defended off the back foot, no room again
too full now, and he push-drives this half-volley to the right of Rampaul and left of mid-off. This is looking ridiculously easy
short of a length, no room, defended to cover
offbreak to begin with, worked away into the leg side
square-drive from Flynn as he gets a wide length ball, but Smith makes another diving save at point
slower offcutter again, pushed towards deepish mid-on for one
wide length ball, angling away, and called wide
another big wide outside off, starting too wide and angling it away
length ball, wide, this time he gets bat on ball and takes a single to deep point
that's a third slower ball out of three to the right-hand batsman, and this time Nicol is expecting it and glances it from in front of off to beat short fine leg
slower offcutter again, flicked to long-on for one
starts with an offbreak, Nicol was sweeping it regardless, and places it wide of deep square
full, offbreak, driven to long-on for one
flat, short of a length, on the pads, 86ks, worked away for an easy single
I called on offreak as I saw the thumb stick out. And offbreak it was. Swept to short fine
this is the knuckle ball, and it starts on middle and leg. Pushed down to long-on
offbreak, starts outside leg for left-hand batsman, worked away. Not much intrigue from Narine in the first over
length ball outside off, angling away, beats the drive
short of a length, outside off, punched square for a single
short of a length, outside off, defended back off the back foot
slower ball again, outside off, cutting in, defended off the front foot

Big lbw shout, and it's really close. Nicol has walked across all the way, and is hit right in front to a short-of-a-length delivery. The height has saved him. It hits the underside of the thigh pad. No review called for. Which is just as well because it was bouncing over
looks to run this down but is cramped for room and dabs it to point
offbreak, starts outside off, left alone
this one starts on middle and leg, takes a thick edge past slip
swept behind square, along the ground, gets a single
full, into the pads, can't miss short midwicket
this is the other one, turning away from outside off, but Nicol seems to have picked it, and opens the face to get a single into the off side
offbreak, starts from outside leg, worked towards square leg where Pollard nearly runs into the umpire. Surely that's not what the umpires signed for
short of a length, outside off, pushed towards mid-off
length ball, outside off, left alone

what a way to get out. This would have been called a wide had he not edged it. It's really wide outside off, and he has done well to reach it on the drive, but all he manages is an edge. He will be kicking himself for that. You don't get such flat wickets and small fields every day
full, into the pads, worked towards long leg for one
short of a length, outside off, defended off the back foot
slower ball, 109ks, floated wide outside off, hit uppishly towards long-off
flighted on middle and leg, misses out
swept away to deep square
short of a length, on off, worked to midwicket
short of a length outside off again, defended back to him
long hop with fine leg up, and he has pulled this between square leg and short fine
flighted outside off, defended off the front foot
and slower offcutter it is, dropped into the covers for a single
length ball, into the pads, worked away for a single, and that Bravo has overstepped means Nicol will get a free hit
It's slow all right, but it is a half-volley on the pads, and he has flicked it over long-on for the third six of the day
bouncer outside off, the quicker variation, left alone, called one for the over
steered down to third man for one
short, wide, cut in front of square for one

Williamson has run up to the striker's end and back. Sammy goes to the wrong end here. Dabbed towards point, Williamson thinks this is past point, but it is not, and Nicol doesn't move. Sammy goes at the striker's end where both the batsmen are, and misses too. Willaimson gets enough time to get back as midwicket shies at the non-striker's end. No-ball too because they didn't have enough men inside the circle
length ball outside off, left alone
offbreak from outside off, cramps him up as he looks to punch
short off break, pulled to deep backward square
the knuckle ball, full outside off, played with the turn, to mid-off
another knuckle ball, beaten by no turn as he looks to dab it
pulls the sweep out, gets an inside edge onto the pad
defends at an offbreak outside off, beaten, and hit on the pad outside the line of off
short of a length, outside off, pushed to point
length ball, outside off, defended with a slightly open face
fuller, angling in towards off, driven, but straight to extra cover
short of a length, no room, punched towards cover-point
looks to punch this down the ground, gets an outside edge to third man for a single
slower ball, picked early, to full too, and swiped from well outside off and deposited one bounce into the midwicket fence
offbreak, turning down leg, called a wide
the other one, doesn't turn, and is defended off the back foot, just outside off
the straighter one again, pushed to cover

offbreak now, and is lazily dragged on. Length ball, outside off, and Williamson stays back to it, and also pushes at it away from the body. The inside edge hits him low on the pad, and rolls onto the stumps. That's a second wicket gifted today. And that's out of three
offbreak, short of a length, middle and off, turning away, pushed to cover
flighted outside off, defended back to him
short of a length, offbreak, goes back to defend it back to him
short of a length, into the pads, punched down to long-on
short of a length, on the stumps, punched to cover
length ball, middle and leg, defended back
short of a length, on the pads, worked away for a couple
length ball, wide off, driven square on the off side
short of a length, on the stumps, pushed back to him
swept away to long leg for a single
offbreak, short of a length, punched away square on the off side
he hasn't picked this offbreak at all. but he is also struck outside the off stump when beaten playing a defensive shot
when in doubt, sweep, and sweep Nicol does for a single to long leg
full, middle and leg, defended back to him
offbreak, starts on off, and Latham lets it turn past the stumps
short of a length, outside off, pushed to cover
short of a length, on off, punched down to long-on for one
bouncer, 128ks, pulled into the ground for a single to midwicket
short of a length, holds its line outside off, beats the edge
That's fifty for Nicol, and Six No. 4 for the day. Length ball, on the pads, and flicked over long leg with ease
looks to run this fine behind square, but the ball is not short enough, and beats him
offbreak, punched square on the off side for a single
misses out on the sweep, but is hit outside the line of off
slightly fuller, and connects with the sweep this time. Gets a single to long leg
he hasn't picked this knuckle ball at all, and this one breaks back in appreciably from the line of off stump. Quicker too, at 90ks, Just about gets an edge to save the stumps
offbreak now, and left alone
nearly done in by another knuckle ball. Bowled at 89ks, short of a length, on off, and he is hit on the pad in front of leg. Fair to say he has no clue which way Narine is turning it
short of a length, outside off, defended to cover
runs this down to third man for a single
length, middle and off, tips and runs before cover can come in
slower ball, on off, pushed to mid-off, and steals a single as Narine is a bit deep
short of a length, outside off, punched to cover
tucked away off the hip for a single
punched to long-off for one
flat again, and punched down to long-on
slower through the air, Latham tries the lap from outside off, and sweeps this into his own body
full, outside off, driven to long-off
length ball, outside off, pushed to the right of cover for a single
comes down the track to take this on the half-volley, and drive it down to long-off

Sammy strikes. It's an interesting dismissal. C Gayle B Sammy. Gayle breaks into a little jig. As for Latham, if you are getting bullied by a Sammy bouncer, well... No disrespect to Sammy, pace like fire is not his virtue. This is dug in short, he goes back for the pull, is late into it, and top-edges it to midwicket
short of a length, pushed to cover, sends back Watling, the new non-striker, who has to dive to make his ground
pushed wide of long-on, but Bravo's quickness there keeps them down to one
and defended to silly mid-on right away
length ball, angling in, played to Gayle at silly mid-on again
full, on off, defended back to him
Another soft dismissal, and Samuels is laughing himself silly here. Short of a length, just holds up a bit, and Nicol is early into the punch, lobbing it back to Samuels
length ball, outside off, defended back to him
flighted outside off, driven to long-on for one
length ball outside off, played off the back foot to the bowler
short of a length, dragged into the on side, but finds short midwicket
short of a length, pushed to the left of short midwicket, but Gayle is quick enough to deny them a single
length ball, into the pads, worked away for a single
short of a length, into the pads, worked away to deep square
a length ball outside off, holds its line, beats the edge of a tentative bat
short of a length, on the stumps, pushed back to him
length ball, outside off, angling in, defended off the front foot
length ball, middle and leg, pushed to midwicket
length ball, stays back, finds the short straight midwicket again
plays the lap sweep, gets a single to fine leg
flighted outside off, pushed down to long-on for one
punched down to long-on
paddle-swept for a single to fine leg
the broom is out again, lapped away for another single
driven down to long-off for one
looks to drive, gets the inside half of the bat, to the silly mid-on
short of a length, angling in towards off, defended off the back foot
length ball, headed towards top of off, defended back to him
slower ball, pushed wide of cover for a single
bouncer, ducks under it
short of a length, pushed to midwicket, and Ramdin goes, "Make him run, boys"
paddled away fine for a single
short of a length, outside off, pushed to cover
this time he has dripped this wide of cover, and calls Watling through for a quick single. Watling hobbles through. NZ don't need another injury here
looks to run this behind square, is beaten
punched straight to cover this time
short of a length, outside off, punched to cover
looks to work this to leg, is beaten by seam movement back in. Hit on the pad, but headed down leg
full, driven to mid-off
short of a length, outside off, punched away to cover
digs this in, 125ks, outside off, and is left alone
slower ball, played to short straight midwicket. First maiden of the innings
lapped away fine for a single
flighted outside off, pushed between cover and extra cover for one
short of a length, looks to cut it, gets a bottom edge, but is safe
full and fast, driven down the ground, Samuels makes a diving save to his right
full again, pushed wide of mid-off for one
short of a length, into the pads, defended to leg
short of a length, on off, defended to cover
short, wide, cuts away, but Smith has been an electric fence at point today
short, wide, cut away to third man for one
slower ball, driven uppishly, short of cover
full toss this time, but finds cover again with this drive
short of a length, punched to that short straight midwicket
plays the paddle sweep first up, gets a single
short, wide, cut away for the first boundary since the 22nd over
flighted outside off, and he goes inside-out, over extra cover. Always a nice shot to watch
short of a length, into the pads, punched to mid-on
paddled away fine for a single
full toss, middle and leg, driven to mid-off, steals a single. A direct hit might have got him here
length ball, outside off, gets a thick edge on the drive, fielded at point
full toss outside off, 134ks, N mac gets a thick outside edge, and on this short field it's going to be four
short of a length, outside off, runs it down to third man for one
short, wide, asking to be hit, and hit Watling does, fine of point, square of third man
slightly fuller and wider, Watling has trouble reaching it, gets a bottom edge to third man for one
looks to square-drive a short-of-a-length delivery, and is beaten outside off
short of a length, just outside off, played to point
short, offbreak, thumped down to long-on for one
no thumb sticking out, and this is the legbreak. On a length, middle and leg, turning towards off, defended to leg
this is the offbreak, and cramps him on the punch
flighted outside off, defended to cover
the knuckle ball now, and defended just outside off stump
slogs at a length ball, gets a single to long-on
short of a length, runs it off the face to third man
Improvisation. Moves right across the stumps, gets really bottom-handed, and scoops this length ball over short fine leg. That takes some doing
a near slog-sweep from outside off, the miscue clears short midwicket
length ball, outside off, driven straight to cover
low full toss, driven to sweeper-cover for one
slower ball, on off, short of a length, makes room, but finds point
length ball, middle and leg, driven to long-on
goes too straight, bowls a wide down the leg side
short of a length, tucked away off the hip for a single
length ball, mis-hit down to long-on for another single
short of a length, no room at all, can't run it down as he attempts to
full, into the pads, and he has protection square and deep on the leg side
short, wide, cut away powerfully past point
digs this one in a little, closer to off, McCullum thinks of upper-cut but restrains himself
dug in again, chest-high, run down to third man for one
short of a length, no room, punched to mid-on
short of a length, late-cuts it to third man for one
short of a length, gets a little big, he rides the bounce to run it down to third man
length ball, into the pads, flicked away to deep midwicket
Six No. 5. Inside-out, on the up. Top shot. Short of a length, on off, and he drives over long-off. High elbow for the pose too

Too cute. Tries to follow up that lovely off drive with a scoop. Gets down on a knee, in front of off, the head falls away as he tries the dangerous shot, and he gets a bit too under it to lob an easy catch for Narine at short fine leg. It is the cutter that has done him in here
short of a length, on off, defended to off
short of a length, worked away off the hip
length ball outside off, left alone
length ball, moves across the line to work this behind square, and Charles dives over the ball at short fine leg
slower ball outside off, defended to cover
not Charles's fault this time. Short of a length, too straight, and helped away off the pads, past short fine leg
yorker just outside off, beats the bat
bouncer this time, he ducks under it as it passes over the leg stump
slower ball, middle and leg, flicked to midwicket
full, on the pads, driven wide of long-on, comes back for the second
offbreak, lands on off, turns away, beats the sweep
offbreak flighted outside leg, beats his attempt at a defence, hits the pad
quicker, flatted one, stays back to defend
offbreak, on off, left alone
offbreak, pitched outside leg, defended to cover
length ball outside off, driven to sweeper-cover
makes room to drill this length ball square of Russell at sweeper-cover. He didn't have too far to go, but this one flew off the bat
full, angling in, driven wide of mid-off
Six No. 6 for the day. Tries the bouncer, McCullum clears the front leg, and hooks this over deep backward square
full outside off, driven, but can't beat extra cover
misses out. Full, outside leg, can't get a touch on it. Off the boot it goes, and close enough for Ramdin to get a hand to it
legbreak, starts outside off, turns away, he moves across to work this to leg, but is beaten by the turn away
another legbreak, this time he works it to leg for a single

walks right past one. Almost as if he was blindfolded. Oram jumps out of the crease, Narine bowls a flat offbreak, and Oram is about a foot away from the line of it. Stumped by a mile. He didn;t even bother trying to make it back
legbreak, starts outside off, defended
big offbreak from outside off, hits the pad, causes a stifled appeal
length ball, turning in, helped around the corner for a single
short of a length, outside off, gets a single to sweeper-cover
slower ball, looks to work this to leg, ends up chipping it towards long-on
length ball, no room, pushed back to him
short of a length, outside off, Mills stands rooted and swings. Looking to go down the ground, gets too under it, and skies it for Gayle at cover
sharp bouncer to welcome him, 135ks, McCullum ducks under it
full outside off, driven to Gayle at cover, and the ball pops out as he looks to run the stumps down. Allows them a single
cut away, Sammy gets a bad bounce at point, allows them a single
short of a length, drops and runs, brings McCullum back on strike
short of a length, late-cuts it to third man for one
short of a length, tucks him up, but they run for a single eve the tough the ball has not even gone off the pitch
short, into the body, pulled away to deep backward square
short, no room, Southee thinks of the upper cut, but decides against it
slower offcutter, jumps at him a little, played back to Russell
drags this one down, pulled away to deep midwicket for one
short of a length, outside off, Southee gets a single to deep cover, and hands it over to McCullum
lovely save by Ramdin. Full ball, hits a foot hole on the crease, between pat and pad, and then breaks in like an offbreak, and Ramdin changes direction well and makes a one-handed save down leg
slower legcutter, a little too short, and Mac saw it early. Waited for it, and cut it behind point. First boundary since the 44th over
appeal for leg-before, and so busy is Russell appealing they sneak off for a run even though the ball is on the pitch. Given a run, seemed an inside edge, and hit outside the line anyway
that's fifty for McCullum, a fighting hand. Short, on off, cut away to sweeper-cover. He gets an applause from his gallery. Fourth fifty for him
short, doesn't rise, and Southee opens the front leg up to pull this between square leg and deep midwicket. Slower ball gone wrong
looks to go behind square on the leg side, but Rampaul goers wide outside off, and beats him
charges at him now. Rampaul bowls the bouncer, and beats him again
late swinging yorker, follows him as he tries to make room, concedes a single off the inside edge
goes deep into the crease to try and slog, but gets an outside edge to third man for a single. At least he keeps the strike

length ball, slower ball, 116ks, outside off, McCullum sees an opportunity to get under it, but is slightly too early into this, and goes only as far as deep midwicket. A fighting hand from McCullum but one that is not likely to be enough
yorker on off, gets a single as he squeezes it out
yorker, quick, 139ks, down leg, but not called a wide
slower ball, full, driven down to long-off for one
short of a length, on the stumps, Southee just makes room and swings, and has connected it superbly for a flat six to cow corner
tries the cute shot behind square on the leg side. Exposes all stumps, toe-ends a full delivery for a couple towards midwicket

inn2.comm: slight shape away, on off, defended back to him
swinging away after starting outside off, left alone
short of a length, on off, slight shape away, defended to cover
angling in this time, defended towards midwicket
half-volley, outside leg, all it needs is a touch past the keeper. Charles gets it
wide half-volley, Charles stands tall, and drives it wide of mid-off. Rollicking start to the chase
and a top start for him. A yorker first up, swinging away a little, kept out. Boult walks back with a smile one
stays full, is driven, but not past cover
full and swinging again, driven powerfully, but straight to mid-off
three full deliveries followed by a bouncer at 138ks, over the top of the stumps, and he sways out of the line
full now, on off, angling in, defended to cover

Edged and can't be taken. Boult pitches on a length, in front of off, swinging away, Gayle pushes at it, gets a soft edge, and that does two things: dies down, and also travels between keeper and first slip. Latham, the makeshift keeper, doesn't go for it. Anyway, would have been a great catch even for a regular keeper
length ball, defended with an open face
length ball, on off, defended off the front foot
swinging half-volley, nicely driven down the ground, just a caress, between the bowler and mid-off, all along the ground
short of a length, looks to cut, beaten
length ball, on the pads, clipped away past square leg for a couple. Gayle casual in finishing the second, and makes it in a photo finish. Nobody realises, though, how close this was
this one starts outside off, is swinging away, and gets a thick edge to third man
this is angled across the right-hand batsman, and is left alone by Charles

that's dead plumb. Umpires don't get to make easier decisions than this. Low full toss, swinging in, and Charles has walked across to play across its line. Hit on the full. Can't get away with it. Boult has had a superb start to his ODI career
length ball outside off, angling away, left alone
length ball outside off, no swing, and Smith leans into the drive, between mid-off and extra cover. McCullum gets a hand to it to save two runs
this one shapes in a little, bunted wide of mid-on for one
good stuff from Boult. Full, just outside off, swinging away. Gayle plays inside the line
length ball, on off, slight shape away, defended square on the off side
length ball, on off, shape again, defended solidly
short of a length, wider, Smith chase it without intent, playing a tame shot away from the body. Admonishes himself after being beaten
full, middle and off, defended to mid-on
length ball, on off, again slight shape away from him, defended to cover
short of a length, outside off, punched to mid-off - maiden over
full and straight, inside-edged to fine leg for one
full, middle and leg, angling towards off, gets a thick edge to point
this one shapes back in, defended to square leg
short of a length, outside off, steered away to third man
dug in short, 134ks, slightly early into the pull, gets it in front of square for one
shout for lbw as this one swings back in from a length. Stifled shout because this is pitched outside leg
Gayle plays for a swinging delivery, but this one holds its line outside off, and beats him by some distance
length ball, angling towards off, defended off the back foot
dug in short, over the top of the stumps, 133ks, Gayle stays away from its line
lovely bouncer, that's headed for the badge on the helmet. Gayle thinks of pulling but withdraws
Gayle swings. Length ball, and Gayle just goes after it, dragging it towards midwicket where New Zealand have a man present. Doesn't carry, but those bouncers have drawn an injudicious shot
short of a length, angling in, defended to mid-on
low full toss, Gayle's bat turns in his hand as he keeps that out
goes wide of the crease, angles it in, and off the pad it goes. Not too pretty from Latham as this is bouncing away softly after a lot of the pace has been taken off by the pad
short of a length, pitched outside leg, concedes a leg-bye
angling into the pads again, this time it bounces back towards the bowler, so no leg-bye will be taken
Bouncer with a deep midwicket in place, but Gayle has pulled it in front of that man. Clears the front leg, and almost swats it
wide of the crease again, angling in again, beats the inside edge, and hits the pad
short of a length, outside off, swiped away to deep midwicket for one
length ball, on off, 135ks, defends with an open face
stays in that same channel, on a length, angling towards off, defended with an open face

Big wicket. Huge wicket. New Zealand know it. This game is not over. Gayle has been tentative so far, and has looked unsettled. Plays at a full delivery without any feet, from inside the crease, and just offers the bat to dry. The slight movement away takes a healthy edge, and Guptill pouches it at first slip
and a nice little bouncer to welcome him. On the top of the stumps, Samuels drops his wrists, and sways out of its line
fuller, but strayed down the leg side
short of a length, just outside off, defended towards cover-point
full, just outside off, dug out to mid-off
length ball, on off, pushed to mid-off
Smith tries to break free. Length ball, outside off, he swishes at it, and the thick outside edge flies over cover
swinging a little into leg, worked away, but can't beat square leg
beats square leg this time. Just a mere deflection off the pads, but timed really well. deep midwicket gives chase towards square leg, but to no avail
a moment after a deft touch, Smith plays the violent lash across the line, only to be beaten by a short-of a length delivery
short of a length, angling in, pushed to mid-on
wide of the crease, on a length, outside off, driven to cover
full and straight, driven gently down the ground, into the stumps, and gets a single off the deflection
Six No. 118 at this venue, and No. 8 today. This is across the line all right, but he has timed it sweetly. Length ball, wide outside off, but he has dragged it over wide long-on
goes wide of the crease, and angles a yorker in. Smith does well to keep it out considering his big back lift
short of a length, punched sweetly down to mid-off
short of a length, into the pads, helped away for a single
length ball, angling in towards off, 126ks, hits the higher part of the defensive bat
angling in from slightly wide, on a length, driven to mid-off

What a mindless shot from Dwayne Smith. Lovely catch from Nathan McCullum, though. Short of a length again, angling in towards off, Smith is caught in the crease as he tries to loft this over mid-off. As he is playing well in front of the body, all he manages is a lob that looks like it might clear cover, but McCullum runs back, and takes it superbly over his shoulder
length ball, on off, defended to cover
short of a length, on off, defended again
length ball, angling in towards off, defended

There is madness all around. New Zealand are accepting all their gifts with glee. Bravo trying only the 14th three in 11 ODIs at this ground. There is a good reason why threes aren't taken here. This is played towards deep midwicket, and he takes on Southee's arm, and is caught well short. Third umpire not even needed. Lovely slide from Southee, a left-handed pick-up, transfer to throwing hand, refusing the relay throw, and returning this right by the stumps, but still a gross misjudgement from Bravo. Not even a desperate dive would have got him in
short of a length, outside off, stays low, beaten
length ball outside off, driven to cover
Samuels continues being at languid ease as he drives this length ball past cover. Open face doesn't matter here. He has middled the daylights out of this delivery
fuller, closer to stumps, driven nicely down the ground, but Mills gets a hand to it in his followthrough
length ball, on off, angling in, defended
short of a length, angling in, defended off the front foot
offcutter, Pollard lets it break in, rides the little extra bounce, and helps it into the leg side
Beautiful off-drive. On a length, angling in, Samuels presents it a straight face, timing it superbly. Williamson dives his right at mid-off, but is slightly early into the dive
shorter now, and steered down to third man for one
wide of the crease, short of a length, angling in, defended back to him
short of a length, outside off, plays defensively with an open face
left alone outside off this time
fuller, on off, defended with an open face

New Zealand fielders can turn into super heroes when they sense they can defend a total. Awesome is a word usually thrown around lightly, but this is truly awesome from Guptill at cover. Nicely punched by Samuels and he takes a few instinctive steps down the wicket. Guptill at cover dives full length, nay he flies, makes a one-handed save, and forget balancing himself, or getting up, he throws in what seems like that same motion, and takes down the stumps at the striker's end. And Samuels, who has only taken a few instinctive steps, is nowhere near the crease when the wicket is broken. Awe. Some. Awe some is what awesome does
length ball outside off, defended towards point
angling in towards off, patted back to him
short of a length, on off, defended to cover
yorker from wide of the crease, kept out
bouncer, over middle and leg, Pollard avoids it easily
digs this in short, well outside off, left alone

more super fielding from New Zealand. this is guided past slip, and Brownlie the substitute makes a diving save at third man. Pollard is surprised he is not getting even a couple for this, and has to rush back
short of a length, outside off, thick edge to third man for one
length ball outside off, driven wide of cover for a single
nicely punched on the top of the bounce, gets a single wide of mid-off
angling in, defended off the front foot
slower ball, just outside off, cutting in, defended off the front foot
short of a length, angling in towards off, defended off the front foot
short of a length, defended with an open face
length ball, outside off, holding its line, defended off the back foot
bouncer at 138ks, over the top of the stumps, and Pollard sways out of its line
fuller, outside off, 133ks, left alone
fuller, shaping in a little, played with an open face to third man
that's rapid, short and wide, Ramdin cuts without feet, and is beaten by the pace, which reads only 136ks on the gun
holds its line outside off, Ramdin gets a thick edge for a single
pushed wide of mid-on for a single
slower short ball, takes him time before pulling it to deep backward square
short of a length, wide, steered away to third man
legcutter. That's skillful. Short of a length, on off, and getting it to go away, beating tholds he edge
holds its line outside off again, beats the bat again
beautiful bowling. Oram goes wide of the crease, makes Pllard play for the angle, and then gets the ball to go against the angle. Beaten again
length ball, angling in, defended back to Southee
fuller, just outside off, defended off the front foot
full, on off, hit back to Southee
short and wide, but cut straight to Brownlie at point
short of a length, outside off, defended towards point

Dropped by Guptill. Can't believe my eyes. Guptill is fielding at a short cover point, so very little reaction time here. Ramdin drives in front of his body, up to the right of Guptill, who goes up one-handed, but gets only finger tips to it
drilled back at him, and he tries to deflect it onto the stumps at the non-striker's end. Misses, but I think Ramdin would have been in
Pollard frees himself up a little. Flighted ball outside off, and lofted powerfully over mid-off. Makes it look easy
defended outside off
full, into the pads, driven to long-on for one
full, into the pads, pushed to short midwicket
driven wide of sweeper-cover for a couple
length ball, on the pads, Pollard shouts two-two-two the moment it lives the bat as he flicks. Gets a couple wide of deep midwicket
short of a length, just outside off, left alone on the angle
aimlessly follows a length ball angling across him, and is beaten
short of a length, on off, left alone with the angle
a miscue but eventually safe. he is looking mid-off here with this loft to a length ball, but thick edge takes it over cover. Could have gone anywhere
left alone outside off this time
length ball outside off, defended to cover
short of a length, on the pads, flicked to square leg
full, on leg, driven to long-on for one
on a length, middle and leg, pushed to midwicket

this is lacking in any cricketing intelligence. Michael Holding's famous words come to mind. Pollard has left a few, and swung at few without any rhyme or reason. This is a length ball, slightly slower in the air, and Pollard swings across its line to find deep midwicket with surgical precision. He could have done the same at least twice before
worked around the corner, Bracewell at short fine leg keeps them tied down, but the direct hit and the ricochet concedes a single
lovely shot. Half-punch-half-drive. On the up to a length ball, and between the bowler and mid-off
short of a length, middle and leg, bunted into the on side for a single
length ball, pitches leg, headed towards off, defended back
short of a length, pitched outside leg, concedes a leg-bye
short of a length, just outside off, pushed to cover
short of a length, on the pads, worked away for a single
full, hit back to the bowler
short of a length, punched down to long-on for one
full, middle and leg, flicked away for a single
slightly short of a length, and the impulsive cutter in Ramdin places it to sweper-cover
short of a length, worked around the corner to square leg
full, middle and leg, driven to straight midwicket
short of a length, nipping back in, inside-edged into the pad
pulled off the front foot, but can't beat square leg
short of a length, cutting in, kept out by Ramdin
sucker ball. After giving him no room through the over, Oram floats one full and wide. Ramdin drives without any feet, and is beaten
slower ball, outside off, defended off the front foot
short of a length, cut to point

back of the bat. Seven down. Sammy is not known for his soft hands, and is done in because of that. Looks to a flick a length ball, is way too early into the shot, and the hard hands mean it lobs back all the way for a simple catch to N Mac
full, on off, driven to mid-off
Russell is going to swing too. Gets under a full delivery, and goes wide of long-on
tossed up on off, defended towards point
slow in the air again, outside leg, swept away to long leg
full, on off, driven down to long-on
length ball on the pad, worked away behind square
short of a length, outside off, pushed to cover-point

Seven, eight, through the gate... Ramdin is trapped dead in front. short of a length, angling in, staying a little low, skidding through, hit on the knee roll in front of middle. Caught on the crease too. They heck for the no-ball, but Big Jake is fine
short of a length, on off, angling away, defended to cover
fuller, closer to the stumps, defended to leg
short of a length, angling in, pushed square on the off side
Russell tees off, and launches this length ball well over long-on for the ninth six of the day
Russell slog-sweeps now, and connects cleanly again for the 10th six of the day. Over deep midwicket she goes. Can he cause some panic with this?
slower through the air, defended outside off

Can you believe it? Guptill has dropped a simple catch. Russell top-edges a slog-sweep, and this one kisses some low-flying aircraft and comes back. Guptill has had ages to settle under it, call for it, think about it. He goes with reverse cups, but the ball hits the palms and pops out. Nobody can believe it. Guptill has dropped tow in one day
defended outside off
pushed wide of point for one
extra bounce as he digs this in short of a length. Beaten outside off
bouncer, only at 130ks, but right over the stumps, and Narine sways out of its line
yorker on off, dug out by Narine
short of a length but gives him room, and Narine punches this through cover-point for four
oh these runs have been coming in thick and fast for the last two overs. Thick edge from Narine, Mills puts in the dive at third man, but his left ankle is touching the rope as he pulls this in
short of a length, angling in, left alone
no air at all. Flat and quick, defended off the back foot
sees a bit of flight, dances down the track, not right to the pitch of the ball but close enough to loft him over long-on. The first man to cross 20 in this innings - 18 of those through three hits
really full, flicked away square for a single
full, outside off, driven down to long-off for one

New Zealand fielders have recovered well from those drops. This time it is Kane Williamson. For any other team, this is driven wide of extra cover, but this team;s captain, Williamson, dives full-length to his right to field this cleanly, and throw this to the bowler while on the ground. Narine has gone through for the single, but Russell hasn't after taking three steps down the wicket. Narine gone. Third run-out of the innings
full, middle and leg, finds midwicket
short of a length, middle and leg, defended to leg
length ball, wide outside off, driven through the cover, all along the ground, all the way for four
length ball, middle and off, defended off the back foot
Nearly cleaned out Russell there. This is some swat. Length ball, outside off, and he swings hoping for the best. What a lively connection, and Russell is ducking for cover. Four through mid-off
slower bouncer, and Rampaul doesn't want to do anything with it
short of a length, on off, pushed to cover-point
and starts with a no-ball. Short of a length, on off, defended, but overstepping too
goes wide of the crease, bowls a yorker, but the toe edge carries it past short fine leg
Short of a length, on the stumps, defended late
short of a length, just outside off, opens up the front leg and lashes. Misses by a long way
slower ball, short of a length, outside leg, defended from deep inside the crease
yorker, middle and leg, dug out for a single
slower ball, on off, defended

Mis-hit for six. Russell looks to go over long-off, but gets too much under it. Long-off is right at the edge, and sees it sail over, but McCullum rushes in from long-on to get a hand to it, but he too has stepped out

Slower ball, and a shout for an lbw.. Not given out. Back of a length, pitches middle and leg, straightens, but doesn't straighten enough for the umpire's liking. They discuss a review, but don't go for it. Replays show it clipping the leg stump
bouncer, hits RR's shoulder before lobbing back onto the pitch
pulled, but short of deep midwicket
down on a knee to drive this down to long-off
short of a length, on top of off, punched nicely, but straight to point
poor delivery, pitched outside leg with fine leg inside the circle, and he has glanced it past the man
short of a length, outside off, cut away for a single

This shall do it for New Zealand. Their first win of the tour. Full ball, Rampaul goes after it, toe-ends it to long-off where Southee completes the catch. West Indies couldn't even take their Batting Powerplay
